casebody.data:
LENTON CONSTRUCTION CO., A CORPORATION OF NEW JERSEY, PLAINTIFF APPELLANT, v. WILLIAM HILL AND AINA HILL, HIS WIFE, INDIVIDUALLY, AND AS CO-PARTNERS TRADING AS W. HILL CO., DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued March 14, 1949 Decided May 23, 1949.

*70Before Judges McGeehan, Donges and Colie.

Mr. Charles Rubenstein (Mr. Leslie P. Glick, on the brief) argued the cause for the plaintiff-appellant. Mr. L. Stanley Ford (Messrs. Ford & Taylor, attorneys) argued the cause for the defendants-appellants. Per Curiam.

The judgment under review will be affirmed for the reasons expressed in the opinion of Judge Leyden, ubi supra.
